text:
CEN 3078 Group Project
Requirements Overview
Feb. 2025
2
Logistics
5 people in one group
Each group choose one project topic
5 Project topics in total
Each project topic, we will have exactly two groups working on that
Group leader must select 
Group leader MUST join leader meetings and report the process
3
Milestones
Milestone 1: February 25th , each group should provide a research plan document detailing the tasks for each team member in the group. 
Milestone 2 (Presentation Day): March 18th or March 20th , mid-term evaluation presentation. Each group should present their process so far and plans for the final output in the class. Mentors can choose to join.
Milestone 3 (Presentation Day): April 22nd or April 24th , final presentation. Each group should present their final outputs to the class. Peer evaluation will be given by professors and students. Mentors should join in the presentation and present together with students. 
Milestone 4: April 29th , final report. Each group should submit a final report of the project including a comprehensive description of the project method, algorithm/modeling details, and evaluation output. Mentors can guide the writing of the report.
4
Team leader regular meetings – Meeting 1
Time: Feb. 21st, 11:00am to 12:00pm
Location: Online Teams meeting
Topics to be covered:
Research Plan Progress: Discuss the status of each group’s research plan document.
Task Allocation: Verify tasks are assigned to individual team members and are well-defined.
Milestone Planning: Ensure each group has set clear intermediate milestones for their project.
Challenges: Identify any challenges faced in planning and task delegation.
Next Steps: Set short-term goals to prepare for Milestone 1 presentation.

5
Team leader regular meetings – Meeting 2
Time: Mar. 14th, 11:00am to 12:00pm
Location: Online Teams meeting
Topics to be covered:
Feedback Review: Discuss feedback from the research plan presentations.
Progress Update: Assess whether groups are meeting their intermediate milestones.
Coordination Issues: Address any coordination challenges or conflicts within teams.
Mid-Term Preparation: Outline expectations for the mid-term evaluation presentation and review draft content.
Support Needed: Determine if additional guidance or resources are required.

6
Team leader regular meetings – Meeting 3
Time: Apr. 11th, 11:00am to 12:00pm
Location: Online Teams meeting
Topics to be covered:
Mid-Term Recap: Review progress and feedback from the mid-term evaluation.
Final Deliverables: Ensure each group has a clear plan for the final presentation and report.
Peer Evaluation Prep: Discuss strategies for improving peer evaluations.
Mentor Involvement: Confirm mentors’ roles in final presentations and report writing.
Risk Assessment: Identify and address any risks that could delay project completion.


7
Presentations
Two presentation – Mid-term and Final
Mid-term presentation time: March 18th or March 20th 
Final presentation time: April 22nd or April 24th 
EVERY team member should present your contributions during the two presentation
Mentors may join to help
Each presentation worth 50 points, and count for 5 points toward final score.


8
Presentation 1 – Mid-term presentation
Goal: Present progress so far and plans for final deliverables.
Key Components:
Recap of Objectives: Briefly restate project goals.
Achievements: Share progress made since the research plan.
Challenges: Discuss difficulties encountered and solutions implemented.
Updated Timeline: Adjustments to the project plan.
Plans for Final Output: Outline final deliverables and next steps.
Duration: 15 minutes per group.
Evaluation Criteria:
Content clarity and relevance.
Demonstration of progress.
Team participation.

9
Presentation 2 – Final Presentation
Goal: Showcase final project outputs and results.
Key Components:
Summary of Objectives: Restate the project’s purpose.
Final Outputs: Demonstrate and explain deliverables.
Evaluation Results: Highlight performance metrics or findings.
Reflection: Discuss lessons learned and areas for improvement.
Team Collaboration: Show how the team worked together.
Duration: 15 minutes per group.
Evaluation Criteria:
Quality and completeness of outputs.
Presentation organization and flow.
Team collaboration and delivery.

10
Project grading policy – From Syllabus
Will be based on the type of project but in general breaks down as: 
Individual Grade: Based on your contribution to the Project and Presentation: 5 pts 
Group Grade: 
Success or detailed analysis of failure of project: 2 pts 
Meetings attended and students display communication: 1 pt 
Details and citations/examples included: 5 pts 
Artifacts for the project are created, turned in, and make sense: 2 pts
Presentation: 5 pts


Points given during the presentation.
11
Final Output – 100 points = 10 points to final grade
Components of Final Output:
Final Presentation Slides:
Clearly summarize project objectives, methods, and findings.
Include visuals to support data and results.
Ensure professional design and organized flow.
Final Code:
Fully functional and well-documented.
Includes comments to explain key sections.
Organized in a repository for easy access and review.
Final Report:
Comprehensive description of the project.
Includes:
Objectives and scope.
Detailed methodology and processes.
Algorithm/modeling details.
Challenges and solutions.
Results and evaluation metrics.
Reflection on team collaboration and lessons learned.
Must follow professional formatting and citation standards.

Submission Deadline: April 29th.
